summary: ClosingSection was updated to show a teddy image with a custom jump animation and added Yes/No choice UI, plus new CSS keyframes/utilities. However, the teddy image asset itself is not present in the diff, the required exact “Yes” confirmation text is not displayed exactly, and reduced-motion handling for the teddy animation is not evidenced in the provided diff excerpts.

missing_requirements.requirement: The teddy has a continuous jump/bounce animation and respects prefers-reduced-motion by reducing/disabling the animation.
missing_requirements.reason: A looping animation class/keyframes are added, but no prefers-reduced-motion handling is shown in the provided CSS diff excerpt.

missing_requirements.requirement: Clicking “Yes” displays exactly: "I love you, wife garu".
missing_requirements.reason: The Yes message includes extra characters (a heart emoji) and therefore is not exactly the specified string.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the generated teddy image asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it via /assets/generated/... path.
missing_requirements.reason: The code references /assets/generated/valentine-teddy.dim_512x512.png, but the diff shows no added static asset file (and no frontend/public/... changes), so the required image file addition is not implemented in the diff.

hallucinated_features.description: Added extra copy and UI beyond the requested Yes/No outcome: a longer thank-you paragraph after “Yes”, and a “Try Again” button after “No”.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3 only asks to display the confirmation message for “Yes” and a playful prompt for “No”; it does not request additional paragraphs or an extra reset button.

hallucinated_features.description: Added emoji characters in the displayed messages (e.g., heart emoji on Yes message; smiling emoji on No prompt).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest specifies exact text for the Yes message and describes the No prompt in English; emojis were not requested and in the Yes case break the exact-text requirement.
